summary: This is an email from Rob, Psy.D., the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator for the Federal Bureau of Prisons, to an unspecified recipient (likely a warden) regarding the scheduling and logistics for a 'Psychological Reconstruction' for inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The email details the materials needed, requests staff assistance for interviews, and outlines the travel and timeline for the multi-day process at the institution.

persons.name: Rob
persons.role: National Suicide Prevention Coordinator, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Author of the email, coordinating the scheduling and logistics for the Psychological Reconstruction of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the planned Psychological Reconstruction, referred to as 'inmate Epstein'.

connections.description: Rob, as the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator, is organizing a Psychological Reconstruction for inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Start of Psychological Reconstruction
events.description: The planned Psychological Reconstruction for inmate Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled to begin, with Rob and a Correctional Services Administrator ready for pickup at 0715.

events.title: Completion of Psychological Reconstruction
events.description: The Psychological Reconstruction for inmate Jeffrey Epstein is expected to be completed by close of business.

keyFacts: A 'Psychological Reconstruction' was scheduled for inmate Jeffrey Epstein by the Federal Bureau of Prisons' National Suicide Prevention Coordinator.
The process was planned to occur over multiple days, from the morning of Tuesday, August 13, 2019, through the close of business on Thursday, August 15, 2019.
The email requests staff assistance for organizing interviews and gathering documents, indicating a detailed investigative or review process.
The correspondence is dated August 12, 2019, which is the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019, suggesting this was a post-mortem administrative or investigative procedure.
